question.title: Why .publishOn() affects predecessing Mono.fromRunnable()?
question.body:
Running

Mono.fromRunnable(() -> log.info("Thread {}", Thread.currentThread().getName()))
        .publishOn(Schedulers.boundedElastic())
        .subscribe();

logs

Thread boundedElastic-<x>

It's not a coincidence, changing the scheduler affects the thread naming accordingly. Why would publishOn() scheduler affect where the lambda in Mono.fromRunnable() is run?

According to the documentation It's supposed to only affect downstream operations, as it does if I run

Mono.just("x")
        .doOnNext(_w -> log.info("Thread before {}", Thread.currentThread().getName()))
        .publishOn(Schedulers.boundedElastic())
        .doOnNext(_w -> log.info("Thread after {}", Thread.currentThread().getName()))
        .subscribe();

where I get

Thread before Test worker
Thread after boundedElastic-<x>
